channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: shipment taken out of system flow due to package leaking package found in trailer# 826447 already damaged leaking upon inspection of inner contents 1 x 50lbs plastic pail/drum of calcium hypochlorite the 50lbs plastic pail/drum was cracked broken and leaking allowing 5lbs to release. no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition

item.title: Report E-2024040662
item.description:
Report E-2024040662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 17, 2024, four (4) 50-pound bags of UN3260 were torn during loading and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3260-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite for transport and disposal.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED BY SUPERVISOR AT THE END OF SUNRISE THAT THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING IN A PACKAGE CAR. RESPONDER WENT TO THE PACKAGE CAR AND TOOK THE BUCKET THAT WAS LEAKING TO PROCESS IT. ALSO CLEANED OUT THE PACKAGE CAR AND REBOXED THE PACKAGES THAT WERE WET. NO OTHER PRODUCT WAS DAMAGED.

item.title: Report E-2024040592
item.description:
Report E-2024040592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: BIRDSBORO
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0725 ET, Martin Parson of XPO XRQ notified ERTS of a 50 lb. release of UN3262 Soda ash/Sodium metasilicate from two (2) 50 lb. paper bags due to the weight of the pallet crushing the bags. The spill was contained to the trailer floor and arrived damaged from the shipper. The caller indicated the spill was cleaned using a shovel and swept into a 10-gallon DF. The SDS was reviewed with the caller to confirm the appropriate cleaning steps were taken. The caller declined dispatch since the spill was cleaned and within the appropriate container. The waste was left in OS&D for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040613
item.description:
Report E-2024040613

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-29T15:12:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: HERMITAGE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: As the material was being prepared to be loaded at the destination terminal's dock, the drum was punctured by the corner of the dock plate as the dock plate was being set down. The drum was immediately turned on it's side to prevent further release. The punctured drum and absorbent materials were placed into an overpack awaiting disposition from the shipper. The packaging specifications were not able to be safely obtained from the container.

item.title: Report E-2024040561
item.description:
Report E-2024040561

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-20
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a 2-gallon release of regulated UN2810 "NOP Oregano Essential" that arrived damaged at Terminal XLF. The caller stated that a fifty-five gallon metal drum was damaged from other freight that was unsecure during transit impacting Trailer #319-3334. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE. The waste was overpacked with oil dri and ppe and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040555
item.description:
Report E-2024040555

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-26T15:12:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-19
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported a spill occurred on the dock in Greencastle, PA. The spill consists of approximately 2 gallons combined from 2 separate products that were shipped in the same boxes, the products being Axalta Plastic Primer Surfacer and 2K Urethane Primer. The freight arrived at the terminal already damaged and spilling prior to arrival, likely due to improper loading by the previous terminal. A total of 4-1 gallon metal cans of product were disposed of in 2-20 gallon poly drums, and the spill was cleaned with Oil Dri. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.
